enb_long_title: United Nations Climate Change Conference - Bali
section_title: UN HIGH-LEVEL MEETING ON CLIMATE CHANGE:
sentences: On 24 September 2007, UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon held a high-level meeting on climate change in New York .

The event, which followed an earlier UN General Assembly informal thematic debate in late July and early August, drew senior officials from more than 150 nations, including 80 heads of state or government.
The high-level meeting aimed to promote dialogue and mobilize political support on the need to achieve a breakthrough at the Bali conference.
Many participants called for binding emission targets or referred to the need to halve emissions by 2050 and limit temperature rise to 2 C.
